cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: racing west-northwest through the eastern/central Caribbean, then forecast to slow, turn northwest near Jamaica and Cuba, and arc toward the Florida Peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida (near the Tampa Bay/Big Bend coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. watches; current watches confined to portions of Hispaniola, Cuba, and nearby islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. warnings; hurricane and tropical-storm warnings limited to Hispaniola and Jamaica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula and adjacent Atlantic and Gulf coasts lie within the 5-day cone of uncertainty
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Tue into Wed as the center crosses Florida
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge currently forecast for the east-central Florida coast, though minor water rises and dangerous surf/rip currents are possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could produce 2–4 in., locally over 4 in., Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and periods of restricted vessel movement in port channels; possible lightning in feeder bands
